data-shareing.content:
You are an information extraction translator, and the user will provide an excerpt from the Terms of Service or Privacy Policy. You will translate the extracts from the terms of service and privacy policies of the major companies related to data sharing into a form such as:

1. whether a third party obtains the data: <obtains or does not obtain or is not stated>

2. Is there any sharing that does not require additional consent from the user: 
<sharing which not require consent>

3. Is there any indication of the purpose for which the data is shared: 
<purpose or vehicle for documenting the purpose>

4. Is there mention the channels for refusal of sharing: 
<mentioned or N/A>,<Whether refusal to share data affects use>.

5.Whether obtain the data from the third party: <Obtain or not obtain or N/A>
<the name of the third party>: <type of information>
<the name of the third party>: <type of information>

**B. Advertising communication and market research based on consent (Article 6 (1) lit.** **(a) GDPR)**
If you have separately given your consent to the further use of your personal data, your personal data may be used in accordance with the scope described in the consent, e.g. for advertising purposes and/or market research, and may be passed on to third parties. Details on this can be found in the respective declaration of consent, which can be revoked at any time.

**C. Data transmission to selected third parties 

**BMW may provide the data collected under point A to third parties in anonymous form for the purpose of use for e.g. push notification services.

Data collected is shared with carefully selected and screened service providers and business partners with whom we work to provide you with products and services. We only do this for BMW AG within the framework of the strict requirements of data processing on behalf of BMW AG, to fulfill a contractual obligation (e.g. forwarding to a payment service provider) or on the basis of your express consent (e.g. forwarding to the insurance provider of the BMW protection cover, if you so wish).

## 

**Who do we share information with and how do we protect it?**

BMW is a company with an international presence. Personal data is preferably processed within the EU by BMW employees, national sales companies, authorized dealers, and service providers commissioned by us.

If data is processed in countries outside the EU, BMW will ensure that your personal data is processed in accordance with European data protection standards thanks to EU-standard agreements, including the appropriate technical and organizational measures. If you would like to see the specific safeguards for the transfer of data to other countries, please contact us using the communication channels listed below.

For certain countries outside the EU, such as Canada and Switzerland, the EU has already determined a comparable level of data protection. Given the comparable level of data protection, data transmission to these countries does not require any special approval or agreement.

##

1. Third party obtaining the data: obtains (with consent)

2. Sharing that does not require additional consent:
   - Advertising communication and market research: The sharing of personal data for advertising purposes and market research may occur with the user's separate consent. The scope of the sharing is described in the consent, and it can be revoked at any time.
   - Data transmission to selected third parties: The data collected may be shared with third parties in anonymous form for purposes such as push notification services.

3. Purpose for which data is shared: 
The excerpt states that personal data may be used for advertising purposes and market research, as well as for the fulfillment of contractual obligations or with the express consent of the user. However, no specific purposes are mentioned.

4. Channels for refusal of sharing: 
It is mentioned .
The consent for further use of personal data can be revoked at any time, but it is not explicitly stated whether refusal to share data would affect use.

5. Obtain data from third party: N/A

default-content.content:
You are an information extraction translator, the user will provide an excerpt of the terms of service or privacy policy you will be the major companies of the terms of service and privacy policy extracted from the user's account, information, and permissions related to the content of a translation into a form such as:

1. User's rights to the account

<whether user have ownership>
<whether the user has the right to use the account>

<whether the user will be notified when the account is withdrawn>.

2. The user's rights to the uploaded information and authorisations

<Is it possible to modify>: <Is there a channel for modification>.

<Can be deleted>: <Is there a channel for deletion>.

<Correction: <Is there a channel for correction?

<Is it possible to enquire>: <Is it possible to provide a channel for enquiry>.

<Whether authorisation can be withdrawn>: <Whether to provide a channel to withdraw authorisation>.

3. Automatic/Default Content

<Whether the account will be automatically withdrawn

<whether it will automatically renew the account>: <whether it will automatically renew the account

<Whether data will be automatically backed up

<Whether it will automatically download

6. Your rights**

You can review the rules for the collection and use of your personal information for this product at any time in the "Settings - Privacy" interface, including but not limited to these Guidelines and **[List of Information QQ Shares with Third Parties](http://rule.tencent.com/rule/preview/) **, as well as the rules for the use of sensitive permissions for this product. 45a0fc30-aa3e-40ce-ab43-ec1d47a7ba4b)**, as well as the rules for the use of sensitive permissions and authorisations for the Product. Please be aware and understand that the services described in these Guidelines and the corresponding collection and use of personal information may vary depending on the specific service you choose to use, as well as the model of the device you are using, the system version and other factors.

During your use of QQ, in order to make it easier for you to query, copy, correct and delete your personal information, as well as to protect your right to withdraw your consent to the use of your personal information and to log out of your account, we have provided you with corresponding operational settings in our product design, which you may refer to the following guidelines for operation. In addition, we have also set up a complaint reporting channel, your comments will be promptly dealt with.

**6.1 Querying and Copying Personal Information

During your use of QQ, you can query and copy your personal information through the interface of "Settings - Personal Information Protection Settings - Personal Information Query and Management". You can manage more of your personal information in the following ways:

1.User's rights to the account

Ownership: not mentioned
Whether there is a right of use: Not mentioned
Whether the user will be notified when the account is withdrawn: Not mentioned

2.User's right to the uploaded information and authorisation

Whether it is possible to modify: Yes
Whether to provide channels for modification: Yes
Can it be deleted: Yes
Is there a channel for deletion: Yes
Can it be corrected: Yes
Is there a channel for correction: Yes
Is it possible to enquire: Yes
Whether to provide enquiry channel: Yes
Can authorisation be withdrawn: Yes
Whether to provide channels for withdrawal of authorisation: Yes

3. Automatic/Default Content

Whether the account will be automatically withdrawn: No
Whether the account will be renewed automatically: Yes
Will data be automatically backed up: Yes
Whether it will automatically download: No

operating-data.content:
You are an information extraction translator where the user will provide an excerpt from a Terms of Service or Privacy Policy. You will extract the terms of service and privacy policy of the major companies in the agreement policy or software service content translated into a form such as:

1. Notify updates

<Updated contents>: <Notify in advance or after update>, <Method of notification>, <Whether user's express consent is required>.


2. Updates without notification.

<Update content without notification>


3. <Whether the old version can still be used after the update>.
4. <Whether historical version terms are accessible>.

6.1 In order to enhance user experience and improve the content of the Services, Tencent may continuously endeavour to develop new services and provide you with software updates from time to time.

**6.2 For the purpose of improving the user experience or enhancing the security of the Services, ensuring the consistency of the functions, etc., Tencent reserves the right to update the Software or change the effect of some of the functions of the Software or the content of the Services without giving you special notice. **

6.3 After the release of a new version of the Software, the old version of the Software may not be available. Tencent does not guarantee that the old version of the Software will continue to be available, nor does it guarantee that it will continue to provide appropriate customer service and maintenance services for the old version of the Software, so please check and download the latest version at any time.

1. Updates will be notified

After the release of a new version of the software, the old version of the software may not be able to be used: notification of updates, the old version of the software may not be able to be used, the user needs to express consent

2.Updates that will not be notified.

Updates to the Software, or changes to some of the functionality and services of the Software.

3. Whether the old version can still be used after the update:

Older versions of the Software may not work.

4. Accessibility without reference to historical version terms

permissions.content:
You are an information extraction translator who will translate the major companies' Terms of Service and Privacy Policies related to the extraction of device and information permissions into a form such as:

<How it will be collected or accessed>
<authorization or information>: <how or what it is collected for>
<Authorisation or Information>: <How or For What Purposes it is Collected>.
The user will provide an excerpt from the Terms of Service or Privacy Policy, and you will need to compile a list of the user information or device permissions that will be collected by the product or service, and how each permission will be collected.

**3. What Personal Data We Use**

**3.1. Basic Account Data**

Telegram is a communication service. You provide your mobile number and basic account data (which may include profile name, profile picture and about information) to create a Telegram account.

To make it easier for your contacts and other people to reach you and recognize who you are, the screen name you choose, your profile pictures, and your [username](https://telegram.org/faq#usernames-and-t-me) (should you choose to set one) on Telegram are always public. We don't want to know your real name, gender, age or what you like.

We do **not** require your screen name to be your real name. Note that users who have you in their contacts will see you by the name they saved and not by your screen name. This way your mother can have the public name 'Johnny Depp' while appearing as 'Mom' to you and as 'Boss' to her underlings at work (or the other way around, depending on how these relationships are structured).

Permissions or Information:

1. Basic Account Data
- Mobile number
- Profile name
- Profile picture
- About information

How it will be collected:
- You provide this information when creating a Telegram account.

For what purposes it is collected:
- To create a Telegram account and communicate with others on the platform.
- To make it easier for your contacts and other people to reach you and recognize who you are.
- The screen name, profile pictures, and username (if set) are always public to allow others to identify you on Telegram.

Note: Telegram does not require your screen name to be your real name. Users who have you in their contacts will see you by the name they saved and not by your screen name.
